strapiPost.title: Your Weekend Ahead
strapiPost.content:
Anyone else finding themselves daydreaming about the weekend? It's hard not to when you live in a beautiful place like NWA. This weekend will be jam-packed with fun for the whole family, including spring scrimmages, Olympic trials and more. Here we go...

  • U-Pick Tulip: NWA's first U-Pick tulip farm opens this week! Perspectability, a local non-profit organization, started True Colors Farm to bring the community together in a beautified, colorful space.

  • Red & White: Arkansas Football will host their Spring Game on Saturday, April 17 at 2 pm inside Donald W. Reynolds Stadium. Fans will be able to attend for FREE, but must claim a ticket online in advance.

  • OZ Trails: You have one more chance to witness history this weekend (April 17-19) and maybe see a future Olympian as Experience Fayetteville hosts the OZ Trails Pro Cup at Centennial Park in Fayetteville.

  • Forest Fest: Join Crystal Bridges in a celebration of food, drink, art, and the spring season at its pop-up Sunday cookout! Explore the museumâ€™s collection of outdoor artworks while listening to live music on the lawn, join a scavenger hunt, or yard games with friends and family.

  • Siloam Springs Farmers Market: The Siloam Springs Farmers Market will be open for business starting this Saturday, April 17. You can also order online and pick-up in person.

  • Live Music Series: Black Apple Hard Cider's live music series continues tonight in downtown Springdale from 8-10pm.

  • April Workouts: The Kansas City Royals baseball team will be utilizing Arvest Ball Park for their Spring training this weekend. You can purchase tickets to watch workouts here.

Happy Weekending!
